summary: This is the daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, for August 9, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, transfers, and statuses (including suicide watch and psych observation) over three shifts. The log is significant as it documents the facility's operations on the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: MCC Daily Operations and Inmate Transfers
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, transfers between units, and monitoring of inmates on suicide watch, psych observation, and in dry cells.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Dry Cell
events.description: An inmate was placed on a dry cell from ZA at 3:15 PM, indicating a security or medical protocol.

events.title: Inmate Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: An inmate was taken off suicide watch at 1:10 PM.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: This log documents the operational status of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 9, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Multiple inmates were on suicide watch or psych observation with inmate companions, indicating a standard protocol for high-risk inmates.
The log notes a malfunctioning public address system, which impacted the ability to conduct PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) announcements.
Routine inmate transfers, counts, and security checks were conducted throughout the day across three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch).
The ending inmate count for the facility was 758, with 72 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
